page.title: 08SCARVA CANAL
page.content: The Canal which passes by Scarva was the first major inland canal to be completed in the British Isles, it was opened in 1742. It was built to carry coal from the coalfield at Coalisland to Newry from where it was carried by ship to Dublin. When the Belfast - Dublin Railway Link was completed in 1852, it ran parallel to the canal. With coalmining stopping at Coalisland and the growing support for rail freight there was a steady decline in the tonnage carried in the late 19th Century and early 20th Century. In 1939 it was decided to abandon the canal.
